comments.body: I like the idea, but quaking sound a little overpowered. If the height was it sent you up was 5 blocks instead of 10 it would fit a little better. It would definitely give the slow falling potion a use in pvp.
There shouldn't be Loyalty on the Javelin, so it doesn't replace the trident, then it would be balanced imo.

I believe a Spear should be added (see my post for full details). A Spear is a lot cheaper than a Javelin to craft and is for the early game. It is also of the "Trident Class" and comes in Flint, Iron, Gold, and Diamond variants. It also has the ability to charge enemies. To do this you simply sprint at a target and if contact is made you deal a critical hit to your foe.

StagmanOG, While the ideas of a Spear and a Javelin are similar, I think that it would make much more sense for the weapon to not include many different variants, at that point there would be no point of the trident entirely. The problem with the ability of a charge being on the weapon already is it also ruins the point of the trident. No One will want to get a trident if a spear has one of its major functions without the required enchantment (Riptide). The Crossbow is an upgraded bow, but it shows some pros and cons to choosing the bow. If the Spear is early game, it defeats the purpose of getting a sword AND getting a bow.

So while I like your idea, but it would ruin the purpose of all the other weapons in the game.

I think the difference in these should be that they should be less affected by armor, but have a longer charge time than a trident unless you are sprinting (also have slightly less range, because you're throwing a huge stick with an iron/diamond/tip {maybe there could be obsidian tipped ones that have more penetration but only has the base damage of an iron javelin})

Not to mention, two of these enchantments are broken.Petrified shouldn't be in game bc it's SOOO OP, if i could stun a mob for 12 seconds it wouldn't stand a chance, and quaking is broken too, as it can be used to knock someone off a ledge easily in pvp (Like skywars, or anarchy servers) by hitting them with quaking, running over, and hitting them (while you are in the air, you take more knockback), if they don't have an ender pearl, it's an easy kill, so please try nerfing this a bit so it doesn't ruin competitive pvp with twin cheap tricks that can be merged.

I just want to live like a simple primitive hunter gatherer in Minecraft nothing op.

So a cheap throwing javelin's would be really cool.
maybe just craft them with flint like arrows but without a feather...
That sounds like it could be beautiful! And given how nicely Emerald Blocks match with Birch, you could create a truly oriental-vibed build :)
If a skeleton dies to a wither rose, it should become a wither skeleton
how about when it gets on the rose, it gets no sword but a bow with wither arrows, that would also make wither potions available
You know, it sounds nice but why bother? I would just take a chorus fruit anytime. (no offence)
Non taken. :D
Can it also be able to be dyed making a variety of colors?

wooden shield: crafted with 7 wood. block 50% damage

iron shield: crafted with 5 iron and 2 wood, block 70% damage

gold shield: crafted with 5 iron and 2 gold, block 75% damage, won't aggro piglins

diamond shield: crafted with 5 iron and 2 diamond, block 90% damage

netherite shield: crafted with a diamond shield and a netherite ingot, block 95% damage, won't burn in fire/lava, knock player/mob when near you

enchantment:

mending, unbreaking

blocking protection, have 4 levelsm, blocking damage =2% for each.

axe block: reduce the cooldown time of shield, now shield breaking is based on a value. -5 value per level, have 3 levels

bouncing: a enchantment that can bounce off projectiles, normal shield now just block it, not bounce it back.

you can only choose between axe block and bouncing

I would love to see the elytra be craftable.  I made a custom recipe I add to some of my worlds where it is made from 6 phantom membranes and 1 stick.  Currently they're horribly difficult to get and easy to lose.  I picked the phantom membranes because those are used to repair elytras.
I think that they are supposed to be hard to obtain. They are, debatably, the most powerful item in the game.
That's OP bro. Sorry but that's why they're hard to get.
I agree. It's way too important of an item in the game now to not be renewable. I'd say they make it like beacons where you have to beat bosses to craft them
I’m thinking, maybe instead, there should be a way to get a worse elytra. What I mean is, you can make an elytra with less durability
Dragon skin, fossils and membrane.

it too hard to find the elytra, especially server, think about it

u play a new server, u want to find elytra, and u use 5 hours, find many citys, but every elytra already grab by other players. 

and other players don't give u a elytra, also the admin.
There a website called chunk base. Shows you where everything is including elytralocations in the end.

An elytra recipe should be unlocked for a player when they retrieve their 1st elytra from an end city.

I think the multiplayer server problem is important. Wherein, the first player to obain an elytra can easily obtain more, and is incentivized to horde a few as insurance against losing flight capability, and occasionally grabs more as they lose them. It becomes increasingly difficult for anyone else to obtain their own, especially for players who don't yet have one. Players with elytra can hand them out, but that would seem to deprive others of the same quest the first player got to experience.

If a player can craft elytras once they've obtained one from an end city, there's no longer an incentive to fly around the end dimension grabbing them up. If people just want to receive one from another player, that still works. If they want to quest for their own and obtain the recipe, that's hopefully a better experience now!
maybe instead of membrane and a stick, a new dragon drop and ender pearls

quick note.  the outlet chest would need to display:

Item name, price, quantity remaining.

All that would be fed from the notification feed.

Why not just make a UI popup button the same when trading with villagers? That would make things much simpler by making a 'Trading' tab in-game, but for players. Walk up to another player and be given the option to trade with what they have inside their inventory at that moment. Sure, it would be cool to have a whole trading interface, but that might drive people away from playing normally (via getting the materials yourself) more often than not if you could trade with every player at one time (finding all that you need with almost no effort).

Didn't realise that this was still alive.  Bikes, I couldn't find a suggestion from you anywhere but yes the vending machine idea is a good illustration (actually yes, very good) but it might also conflict with worlds that want to create shopping centres (or not if they have to be refilled like vending machines).

 

The trading button idea defeats the purpose behind this, and that is that it allows remote trading for smallish amounts (say 1 stack) while you are busy elsewhere and on pvp worlds it should reduce trading 'ambushes' (or muggings).
Fantastic idea!
To have it not be possible to have it on a bow with either Infinity or Mending and have it be ballanced against those?

This would be a great improvement to the bow, especially due to the target block now being a thing.  Would make mini-games much more accessible, as currently, hitting the bullseye from a distance is largely a fluke due to the randomness of the arrow flight.  3 levels of accuracy would be good, each reducing the levels of randomness the flight of the arrow takes.  It should be available on any bow regardless of other enchantments like infinity or mending.
Great idea !
For the PvP community this would be great! You could find it maybe in Pillager Outposts or maybe in a new Pillager structure. Mobs could spawn with that enchantment on their weaponry already too.

Yes, this is a “slippery slope”.  Soon, people are going to want slopes of all angles; next, they will want slopes for every type of block imaginable; and finally, they will want to place individual pixels in order to make a rounded look.  Keep Minecraft blocky, PLEASE!!
Don't put sloped in Minecraft they are cursed images

Cant' believe they still don't have this.  If you just make it function exactly like stairs but have it skinned so that it appears as a smooth 45 degree angle it should be easy to program and apply to all blocks that have stairs already...then they just need to add it for grass so that I can have grassy slopes :)
Still surprized this isn't a thing yet. Been waiting for slopes for over a decade at this point.

This would be interesting, but only if it isn't required.  But it would be awesome as a way to not have to babysit your animals to breed them up.

However, baby animals shouldn't eat the hay bale to grow.  Otherwise it would only be good for one breeding and then the baby would eat the rest.
That's what a lingering potion is for. Why would the devs waste their time coding in thirty new liquids?
That's what the lingering potions are, except less OP
Thats really nice
The functions with that would be crazy!
If you will place the potion it would work like water that would be cool
nice
Thx

Perhaps the glint could only activate when the block is attempted to be damaged, so it won't cause visual glitches

Kind of like when there's a barrier protecting something on series that involve magic, it's usually hidden until characters try to damage it.

I agree with the idea of adding unbreaking to the blocks as it would add to the uses of experience orbs,

and also add more of a point to building redstone puzzles/doors, if a player were to enchant-protect all of the blocks surrounding the mechanism.
Because getting iron buckets is too hard? Really? That doesn't make much sense.
I believe that every bucket should have a durability, it is really strange that you only have to make 1 bucket and it stays for the rest of the game, unless you get rid of it.
What’s mean? What is stone bucket’s advantages?
Or how about being able to place gunpowder like redstone dust, and ignite that?
String is already place-able though so it seems simpler to do.

I like the idea of a fuse, string is often rather common, while finding gunpowder can be a real pain. For me, getting even some tnt is difficult enough, as creepers dont cope well, and then to waste it on one explosion? No way...

Yes definitely this would be cool!

And then have a new "Gunpowder String" which is just string and gunpowder, and that would be a much faster burning fuse. It would also burn away if it was attached to tripwire hooks and then stood on. (Cool for adventure maps where you have to go through a door very quickly and you only get one chance because the tripwire activation burns away)

ThornyWhistle9
You are right about gunpowder being hard to get
alot of people with older maps and more stuff will find that just making a bunch of TNT isn't very satisfying though, so gunpowder should be more useful.
 
Still, this post is better for the fuse becuase string is easier to get.
Radios don't really fit into Minecraft and real life songs would probably ruin the games image (especially rap) and would probably be really expensive

Remember copyright and paying for the privilege of using music.  There's also the fact that different people have different tastes in music.  For example, I cannot stand rap in any form. (I like melody in music).  If you want to listen to your favorite music while playing minecraft, I think you can figure out how to play your own music collection xP

This doesn't really go with the theme of minecraft..

You can use pre-existing solutions, like Spotify listen together, or a discord call, for music

Carved Melon used to create Melon Golem.
And using shears on melon give one melon silence.

MrD1085277, Yeah and it could be made out of gold blocks and carved melon and be called a glistering golem (like glistering melon) or just golden golem. Additionally another golem could be made out of hay bales and a carved melon to form a scarecrow, who will throw eggs instead of snowballs (the eggs won't produce chickens).
Pumpkins and Melons should be able to have different things carved into them

As Minecraft Earth is ending, the Melon Golem should be added to the standard game, and with it a new block, the carved melon.

Using the scissors on the side of the melon, we would cut a smiling face in it and get one piece of melon.

Carved Melon, apart from being used to create a Melon Golem, would have decorative functions and could be turned into a Melon Lantern. It would shine fainter than the Pumpkin Lantern, because the only light would come from his eyes.

The Melon Golem has a different face than the Pumpkin Golem, for example it may appear to be wearing sunglasses.
This could improve sewer builds.
This could also make for a less harsh look to the edge of the Pale Garden biome. Any Pale Oak leaves overhanging the Biome border would fade yellow to grey rather than a vibrant green to grey.
Could also be achieved with glowstone dust
Maybe the uses could be different?

They need purpose and balance, not "just another armour set" (too repetitive for the same task every time). Amethyst is too fragile and already has unique uses. It'd be better if there were new items to collect for improving existing armour sets, like ruby to embellish and affect certain ability stats or something.
That is a LOT of requests. You can bring IDEAS.
ma sens.
Food&Cooking Update when?
Yay
Great idea, this would make sorting a heck of a lot easier! But the classic chest type should not disappear if this features was added!
Same with the ladders ! They do it for boats and trap doors too why not ladders ? And possibly the crafting table ?
Now that they're adding copper chests, this is much more possible.
Copper golem :)
Vote for the copper golem
Oi o cobre e um minério único que agente não usa vamos fazer isso pelo cobre
